sanskrit_verse: यदधीते यद्यजते यद्ददाति यदर्चति । तस्य षड्भागभाग्राजा सम्यग्भवति रक्षणात् ॥ ८.३०५॥
transliteration: yad adhīte yad yajate yad dadāti yad arcata | tasya ṣaḍbhāga-bhāgrājā samyag bhavati rakṣaṇāt || 8.305 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: He who studies, he who performs sacrifice, he who gives, he who worships — from protection of these six parts, the king becomes whole.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises through alignment with dharmic action
Causation is established by conscious participation in Vedic order
Capacity-based responsibility flows from engagement in study, worship, giving and ritual
Restoration logic requires preservation of integral societal functions
Consciousness alignment occurs when rulers uphold Vedic participation
executable_legal_axioms: IF a ruler protects the sixfold dharmic activities (study, sacrifice, giving, worship, governance, service) THEN legitimacy is automatically sustained
IF any of the six pillars are neglected THEN systemic instability is triggered until restoration
WHEN citizens engage in all six dharmic acts THEN state responsibility reduces proportionally
IF leadership fails to safeguard Vedic activity THEN authority self-invalidates
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, this verse establishes that sovereignty rests not on coercive power but on preservation of society's spiritual-economic-cultural matrix. The court must recognize that true authority emerges only where the six pillars—learning, sacrifice, charity, reverence, protection, and service—are actively upheld by both rulers and ruled.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that kingly completeness manifests solely through preservation of sacred civic life. There is no punitive clause here; rather, anupūrvaśaḥ shows that neglect leads to natural dissolution of authority. Responsibility lies in sustaining dharma, not enforcing it. Misalignment results in automatic diminishment of sovereignty without external judgment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate reconnection programs linking rulers with Vedic scholars and practitioners
Reinstate public sacrifices and educational endowments as markers of royal duty
Establish citizen-led review councils to monitor dharmic participation levels
Deploy consciousness recalibration processes for leaders showing disengagement signs
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed: kingship derives its completeness from守护 the six limbs of dharma. Thus Dharma is restored, reality remains non-punitive, and consciousness alone reigns as the Supreme Adjudicator.
